description: SOAP Web Service with WSDL description available. Application implements SOAP-based services for account/financial operations as indicated by CSS references and WSDL endpoint. Service appears to handle account information and transfers based on CSS class names in application styling.
notes: SOAP service endpoint accessible via WSDL at /wsdl. CSS contains references to account operations and SOAP result displays. The actual SOAP endpoint likely requires authentication via /login. WSDL content is minimal/empty, suggesting dynamic generation or restricted access. Typical SOAP vulnerabilities include XXE, SOAP injection, and WS-Security bypass. Given the Werkzeug debugger RCE, authenticated access might not be needed to compromise the service.
